content:
Your global customers expect your bots to understand their native language. To know what your customers are saying, your bots must know how a language works. Bots use natural language understanding (NLU) and named entity recognition (NER) to understand language and local details such as dates, currency, or number formatting.

You can build Einstein Bots for one language or multiple languages. You must define at least one primary language for each Einstein Bot on the Bot Overview page. See Set or Update a Bot Primary Language and Add or Remove a Secondary Bot Language.

To view and edit language-specific data in the Bot Builder, you must enable the language in Language Settings, activate it in Translation Workbench, and manage secondary language translations.

Einstein Bots support multiple languages with varying levels of NLU and NER capabilities. Supported languages include Arabic, Bangla / Bengali, Bulgarian, Catalan, Chinese (Simplified), Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, French, Georgian, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hindi, Irish, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Malayalam, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil and European), Romanian, Russian, Slovak, Spanish, Swedish, Tamil, Telugu, Ukrainian, and Vietnamese.

Every Einstein Bot requires a primary language to be able to understand your end users. Defining a bot primary language helps with natural language processing (NLP) and named entity recognition (NER).
title: Einstein Bot Language Support
